member.name: M:TingenWebService.Configuration.RuntimeConfig.Load(TingenWebService.Properties.Settings,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the runtime configuration for the Tingen Web Service.
member.remarks: Most settings are from the Web.config file.
member.returns: A dictionary with the runtime configuration.

member.name: T:TingenWebService.ProjectInfo
member.summary: Provides additional information about the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
About the Tingen Web Service
Netsmart's Avatar™ is a behavioral health EHR that offers a recovery-focused suite of solutions that leverage real-time analytics and clinical decision support to drive value-based care.
While Avatar™ is a robust platform, it isn't perfect. The good news is that you can extend myAvatar™ functionality via Netsmart's Avatar™ Web Services, and/or custom web services that are written by other Avatar™ users.
Tingen is one such custom web service which includes various tools and utilities for Avatar™ that aren't included in the official release, and provides a solid foundation for building additional functionality quickly and efficiently.

member.name: T:TingenWebService.TingenWebService
member.summary: The entry class for the Tingen Web Service.
member.remarks: For more information about the Tingen Web Service, please see the file.

member.name: M:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.RunScript(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String)
member.summary: Determines what the Tingen Web Service will do, if anything.

remarks.note:
This method contains a number of log commands that may be used during development, but should be commented out in production code.
These commands are not part of the public API, since the logging infrastructure hasn't been initialized at this point, and they are all a little bit different and write to different locations.
I want these commands to be available for developers to use as needed, but at the same time I want to minimize the amount of clutter they create. Hence, I've attempted to keep them on a single line, including an in-line comment.

The runtime settings are built using values in Web.config, but since Outpost31 doesn't reference the TingenWebService project, the values are converted into a dictionary instead of a strongly-typed object. This makes it easier to pass to Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.Start(), at the expense of making the class a little uglier.
Care must be taken to ensure the keys in Web.config match the keys expected by the code.

Do not change the names of the following parameters:
origOptObj
origScriptParam
For some reason, changing these names causes the web service to fail.

member.param: The original Script Parameter that is sent from Avatar.
member.returns: An representing the result of the Script Parameter request.

member.name: M:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.LogMsg(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String)
member.summary: Build a message for the critical error.
member.remarks: This is here so it won't clutter RunScript().
member.param: The original Script Parameter that is sent from Avatar.
member.returns: A message for the critical error log.
